page.title: 18GRETTON PLAYGROUND GAMES
page.content:
"RED LETTER" : One person is on, and chooses a letter - called the RED LETTER. He stands several metres from the other players who are on a start line facing him. He calls out any letter. If a player has that letter in his name, he jumps as far as he can, but if he jumps when the RED LETTER is called, he must go back to the start. The first to cross to the caller is the winner.
"HOP SCOTCH" : HOP SCOTCH is played on a grid of squares numbered 1 - 10. A player has to throw a stone into square 1. Then he hops over square 1, into every other square and back, picking up the stone on his way. Then he repeats with square 2 and so on. Players take turns, the first to complete number 10 being the winner.
